header.topics: scruffy clothes, breakfast, fruit farms, deserted medieval villages, roadworks, jam, coffee, growing herbs, old people, junk mail, phones, selling ANON's old house

speaker.fls: French -- level unspecified; German -- level unspecified; Chinese -- level unspecified

that's then they nee I'm away when they need watering erm

they just have so much more flavour than anything from the supermarket
but that's why really why I guess why I want to get my orchard up and running

and decided that she wasn't fit to live on her own and we were going oh my god because my mother's mother was really really adamant she was not going into anywhere and she had stroke after stroke at intervals you know and every time she she lost a little bit of mobility and
and she was mentally she was absolutely fine but but she could just about move around her own house with a Zimmer frame and luckily it was a bungalow and she had meals on wheels
for lunchtime five days a week

so he called an ambulance and she'd actually had a stroke while she was getting undressed the night before and spent the whole night sitting in a chair in her underwear unable to move
and was sort of ended up being rushed to hospital wrapped in foil cos she had hypothermia
a non central heated bungalow of course

cos they had one at that point

and a lot of offices were still using faxes

and that number was the company number they had a different line for personal things

but you've picked the phone the phone would ring and I have no means of switching of doing anything with it because it I didn't have an answerphone yet
and I pick it up and all I was getting was this bloody beeping noise
and I ended up having to unplug the phone every night and it was so annoying
